meta.title: The Bioregional Compass - Global Governance Framework
meta.description: A comprehensive guide for forming Bioregional Autonomous Zones (BAZs) and building regenerative communities rooted in reciprocity with land and people

title: The Bioregional Compass
subtitle: A comprehensive guide for forming Bioregional Autonomous Zones (BAZs) and building regenerative communities

languageFallback.title: Content in your language coming soon
languageFallback.description: This section is currently displayed in English until translation is complete.

errors.contentInDevelopment: This content is still being developed.

quickStart.title: Quick Start Resources
quickStart.description: Choose from these essential resources to begin your BAZ formation journey

main.title: Complete Guide Sections
main.description: Explore the comprehensive resources and guidance for BAZ formation

library.title: Resource Library
library.description: Comprehensive toolkits and detailed resources organized by implementation pillar

playbooks.title: Specialized Playbooks
playbooks.description: Strategic guidance for complex challenges and specialized scenarios

guide.title: The Complete Formation Guide
guide.description: Step-by-step journey through the six pillars of BAZ formation

footer.note: This guide is part of the Global Governance Framework initiative to support regenerative community formation worldwide.

pillar0.title: The Inner Ground
pillar0.subtitle: Cultivating the Consciousness for a New World
pillar0.description: Build inner resilience and collective awareness through personal practices and community dialogue

pillar1.title: The Spark
pillar1.subtitle: Vision & Consensus Building
pillar1.description: Ignite collective will through trust-building and shared vision creation

pillar2.title: Finding Our Place
pillar2.subtitle: Defining the Bioregion
pillar2.description: Map the ecological and cultural contours of your place with Indigenous guidance

pillar3.title: Building the Vessel
pillar3.subtitle: Legal & Institutional Scaffolding
pillar3.description: Create legal containers and governance structures for BAZ aspirations

pillar4.title: Weaving the Council
pillar4.subtitle: Governance Formation
pillar4.description: Build governance systems rooted in Indigenous wisdom and participatory democracy

pillar5.title: Installing the OS
pillar5.subtitle: Core GGF Framework Integration
pillar5.description: Integrate Global Governance Framework protocols for planetary connection

pillar6.title: Igniting the Engine
pillar6.subtitle: Economic Sovereignty
pillar6.description: Activate regenerative economy with Hearts, Leaves, and AUBI systems

baz.title: Bioregional Autonomous Zone (BAZ)
baz.description: A governance model that aligns human communities with ecological boundaries and Indigenous stewardship protocols

aubi.title: Agential Universal Basic Income (AUBI)
aubi.description: A system that provides unconditional income while rewarding ecological and care work

hearts.title: Hearts Currency
hearts.description: Value system that rewards care work, community building, and social well-being

leaves.title: Leaves Currency
leaves.description: Value system backed by ecological health metrics and restoration work

fpic.title: Free, Prior, and Informed Consent 2.0 (FPIC 2.0)
fpic.description: Enhanced Indigenous consent protocols for all land and cultural decisions

mvb.title: Minimum Viable BAZ (MVB)
mvb.description: The first milestone that shifts a community from planning to operational BAZ status

foundation.title: Foundation Phase (Years 1-2)
foundation.description: Inner work, vision building, and bioregional mapping

systemSetup.title: System Setup (Years 2-4)
systemSetup.description: Legal frameworks, governance formation, and GGF integration

homestead.title: Homestead Scale (<100 people)
homestead.description: Informal governance, simple legal structures, local economy focus

village.title: Village Scale (100-5,000 people)
village.description: Formal governance with citizen assemblies and public treasury

bioregional.title: Bioregional Scale (5,000+ people)
bioregional.description: Sophisticated legal personhood and multi-layered economy
